purpose.summary: This PSB source file defines a single IMS database PCB named PAUTBPCB for accessing DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=AP and KEYLEN=14. It senses the root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0), enabling qualified and unqualified DL/I calls to these segments. The PSB is generated for COBOL language with PSBNAME=PSBPAUTB.

inputs.name: PAUTSUM0
inputs.description: Root segment (PARENT=0) sensed for access via DL/I calls such as GU/GN

inputs.name: PAUTDTL1
inputs.description: Child segment under PAUTSUM0 sensed for access via DL/I calls such as GU/GN

outputs.name: PAUTSUM0
outputs.description: New root segments insertable via ISRT after positioning

outputs.name: PAUTDTL1
outputs.description: New child segments insertable via ISRT under PAUTSUM0 after positioning

business_rules.description: PROCOPT=AP governs segment access, permitting positioning (GU/GN) and insert (ISRT) DL/I calls but prohibiting update (CHG) or delete (DLT)
business_rules.logic_summary: AP combination allows cursor positioning before inserts to establish sequence/parentage; applies to sensed segments PAUTSUM0 and PAUTDTL1

open_questions.question: What are the exact segment layouts and key fields?
open_questions.context: PSB defines access but not field-level details; these are in DBD/PSBGEN output or application copybooks
open_questions.suggestion: Examine DBD source for DBPAUTP0 or COBOL programs using PSBPAUTB

open_questions.question: Which application programs use this PSB?
open_questions.context: PSB source does not specify callers
open_questions.suggestion: Search JCL/COBOL for PSB=PSBPAUTB or PCB references
